document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Languages Other Than English

CF7E024111E84E18B08B8F7CE13C96BC.description: describe people, objects, or situations orally or in writing with essential details.

A262B3E89B684E55A4B1F532A623AA52.description: express and support an opinion or preference orally or in writing; and

45E9D2036B64419DA83760CC6825E277.description: Presentational communication: speaking and writing. The student presents information orally or in writing using a mixture of phrases and simple sentences with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

B4BB86EE2989470ABC59B4DB0F45A417.description: identify cultural practices from relevant print, digital, audio, or audiovisual materials.

7C163A780813431A9616E1B281FB37FE.description: infer meaning of unfamiliar words or phrases in highly contextualized texts, audio, or audiovisual materials; and

080CB2CAB42A4F5FA03A1B123BF6FAB6.description: identify the main idea, theme, and supporting details from fiction or nonfiction texts or audio or audiovisual materials;

4FE1E0C97608411E86C9380D666F96E1.description: demonstrate an understanding of culturally relevant print, digital, audio, or audiovisual materials in classroom contexts;

5843577CE0D340D283E708FC68EFB5DF.description: Interpretive communication: reading and listening. The student comprehends simple connected statements from culturally relevant print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials as appropriate within contextualized situations and sources. The student uses the interpretive mode in communication with appropriate and applicable grammatical structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

40F1EFB79439447A9CDD61107B7314AC.description: ask and tell others what they need to, should, or must do in spoken or written conversation using appropriate constructions such as the imperative mood, impersonal verbs, or the subjunctive mood.

34700494489A4E82B5AF5B6E8741A825.description: express and exchange personal opinions or preferences in spoken or written conversation using simple constructions such as impersonal verbs; and

518A5AE63C864D1E83536289FB498B5F.description: ask and respond to questions with simple elaboration in spoken or written conversation;

C1C9C49A41B14D71ADEF062C6BC9CEE2.description: Interpersonal communication: speaking and writing. The student negotiates meaning through the spoken and written exchange of information in a variety of contexts. The student uses a mixture of words, phrases, and simple sentences with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

BDEE4E0C13A1488FAB961FDE3D1958CC.description: Classical Languages, Level II, Novice Mid to Intermediate Mid Proficiency

3EC7F1C62A3E4C4D860AE5F2265A6BA1.description: describe people, objects, or simple situations orally or in writing using a mixture of words, phrases, or simple sentences.

ECCF6F7A30184EB7B776988631238405.description: express an opinion or preference orally or in writing; and

64361A4644EA4E7D8EF11EEDA30EC578.description: Presentational communication: speaking and writing. The student presents information orally or in writing using a mixture of words and phrases with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

E0ACF360B5F84EE18950A101DAC45494.description: identify cultural practices from authentic print, digital, audio, or audiovisual materials.

79535BE084DE40C896A0A7F67473ACEA.description: infer meaning of unfamiliar words or phrases in highly contextualized texts, audio, or audiovisual materials; and

3274D5A5FE8E4D62BE3E3EF778ED6279.description: identify key words and details from fiction or nonfiction texts or audio or audiovisual materials;

287FFE8456464F4F81F14C26DF1C6A15.description: demonstrate an understanding of culturally relevant print, digital, audio, or audiovisual materials in classroom contexts;

9168E56E62CD48349ED73B55FCD5AA02.description: Interpretive communication: reading and listening. The student comprehends sentence-length information from culturally relevant print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials as appropriate within highly contextualized situations and sources. The student uses the interpretive mode in communication with appropriate and applicable grammatical structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

278FF6F323314C479E2B2090FFD19CDC.description: articulate memorized requests, greetings, and introductions in spoken or written conversation.

6010DE98829948CE8B12D2EEA1F5CEF8.description: ask and respond to questions, such as yes/no questions, either/or questions, or who/what/where/when questions, in spoken or written conversation in classroom contexts; and

29B053A5EE19420299043567579193D7.description: Interpersonal communication: speaking and writing. The student negotiates meaning through the spoken and written exchange of information in a variety of contexts. The student uses a mixture of words and phrases with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

039A683CB6964D488403F291625B1B61.description: Classical Languages, Level I, Novice Low to Intermediate Low Proficiency

A3088D8E16D747CE881AF38DCD7F97F6.description: describe people, objects, and situations orally and in writing using a series of sequenced sentences with essential details and simple elaboration.

0C830F360250497BAA5C049FC9B75DE3.description: express and support an opinion or preference orally and in writing with supporting statements; and

E509019F62BD491D8FF2D56692215827.description: Presentational communication: speaking and writing. The student presents information orally and in writing using a mixture of phrases and sentences with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

F60C9300AB3B469F8E75C2FA6487A797.description: identify cultural practices from authentic print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials.

B5C4BDD68C0B480C81946B4E33DA146D.description: infer meaning of unfamiliar words or phrases in highly contextualized texts, audio, and audiovisual materials; and

6C4FA84D6ABE4B12A9B0AB6F3E573A29.description: identify the main idea, theme, and supporting details from fiction and nonfiction texts and audio and audiovisual materials;

29440E198F344880A34F3AF44C198348.description: demonstrate an understanding of culturally authentic print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials in everyday contexts;

070BE2D9A9E147798EDEC7FBA7A60BD2.description: Interpretive communication: reading and listening. The student comprehends simple connected statements from culturally authentic print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials as appropriate within contextualized situations and sources. The student uses the interpretive mode in communication with appropriate and applicable grammatical structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

41049845DBED4B85B2EBE2AE074131D5.description: interact and react in writing using culturally appropriate expressions, register, and style.

9C081FF66B354B55819EF40B8C5ADE67.description: interact and react in spoken conversation using culturally appropriate expressions, register, and gestures; and

22E76B90F6884F14BF02463A79012B22.description: articulate requests, offer alternatives, and develop plans with simple supporting statements in spoken and written conversation;

FC882A4BB64F4EBA8AEB75C830208DA9.description: ask and tell others what they need to, should, or must do with simple supporting reasons in spoken and written conversation;

D74CFD31503643BAA66DA67ADB1048B3.description: express and exchange personal opinions or preferences with simple supporting statements in spoken and written conversation;

DC020AAA93E245298B27C6A1F14E857B.description: ask and respond to questions about everyday life with simple elaboration in spoken and written conversation;

A6BB61AD519F463D8395766B4136E55D.description: Interpersonal communication: speaking and writing. The student negotiates meaning through the spoken and written exchange of information in rehearsed and unrehearsed situations in a variety of contexts. The student uses a mixture of short statements and sentences with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

5DC12E2FE40449AE8E689EDD495B6E0E.description: Level II, Novice High to Intermediate Low Proficiency

15994BF145CF461D89CDED0A0F9C4548.description: describe people, objects, and simple situations orally and in writing using a mixture of words, phrases, and simple sentences.

D5320A30158A4F999774B6F8A52EFC2A.description: state and support an opinion or preference orally and in writing; and

3A49BB2C37DA4AD4B9DB9D7B2C9BE590.description: Presentational communication: speaking and writing. The student presents information orally and in writing using a mixture of words and phrases and some simple sentences with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

56C0094F15FC4493ADFA813D1D3C4B00.description: identify cultural practices from authentic print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials.

3CE5C9C555AC4966A13C8BF6EA8A3490.description: infer meaning of unfamiliar words or phrases in highly contextualized texts, audio, and audiovisual materials; and

C391B97D09B34B0CBA42FDC071335333.description: identify key words and details from fiction and nonfiction texts and audio and audiovisual materials;

D66A889342374FF8BCD631A854BFBCDD.description: demonstrate an understanding of culturally authentic print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials in everyday contexts;

DC0D9C2BFBE547F7A1C213A0E2CC66FC.description: Interpretive communication: reading and listening. The student comprehends sentence-length information from culturally authentic print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials as appropriate within highly contextualized situations and sources. The student uses the interpretive mode in communication with appropriate and applicable grammatical structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

F4FF275DBA2A4E5385F07AC6E75BA805.description: participate in written conversation using culturally appropriate expressions, register, and style.

CD8C082639A742F4920D9ED0EBF56D20.description: participate in spoken conversation using culturally appropriate expressions, register, and gestures; and

C2EC8622357442EFBAA76AF98F20264E.description: articulate requests, offer alternatives, or develop simple plans in spoken and written conversation;

0847DD786C1A45579BD7EADF7E1797EA.description: ask and tell others what they need to, should, or must do in spoken and written conversation;

B5BBBF37A87D41C986E79C421647C46A.description: express and exchange personal opinions or preferences in spoken and written conversation;

E4DB548945E840D9BCABBC3FA67A7402.description: ask and respond to questions about everyday life in spoken and written conversation;

2A763BD992494C80AD98DDF357F0DE16.description: Interpersonal communication: speaking and writing. The student negotiates meaning through the spoken and written exchange of information in rehearsed and unrehearsed situations in a variety of contexts. The student uses a mixture of words and phrases and some simple sentences with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

CF434FBE534B42C8AD82A36CC6E8BEF5.description: Level I, Novice Mid to Novice High Proficiency

66A1A5834F05494F9D17D2D57CE3502D.description: show evidence of becoming a lifelong learner by using ASL at the novice-to-intermediate proficiency level for personal enrichment and career development.

099EF7A6852C4FD0B592688D779A36DC.description: use technology to communicate with the Deaf/ASL community; and

AC27A0FB6C8C4529A03C276B1AAB1B58.description: apply ASL at the novice-to-intermediate proficiency level in or out of the school setting through involvement in cultural activities such as attending Deaf events;

03B42E26A92E414AB67AD638BADAEFAF.description: Communities. The student participates in the Deaf/ASL community by using ASL. The student is expected to:

1FCD8D2E453A4C608C2C14A66CEB899E.description: demonstrate an understanding of how one language and culture can influence another.

C09D2D8071A840769DE5B22551AA30B9.description: demonstrate an understanding of the nature of culture through comparisons of the student's own culture and the American Deaf culture; and

C6873DD3654F41DB9D48B5B3E1D11166.description: demonstrate an understanding of the nature of language through comparisons of the student's own language and ASL;

B92DDE3452374F5CA4FC956E1395CCA8.description: Comparisons. The student develops or expands insight into the nature of language and culture by comparing the student's own language and culture to ASL and American Deaf culture. The student is expected to:

E02475F097D140EFAB4D45112258DB35.description: use ASL to obtain, reinforce, or expand knowledge of other subject areas.

B7EFFDA60BE0495DBB7A257D81BFA417.description: use resources and digital technology to gain access to information about ASL and Deaf culture; and

B6375E958FD64E1EA7EFF527F8AD9207.description: Connections. The student uses ASL to make connections with other subject areas and to acquire information. The student is expected to:

6F35B3D8001649B4B7908928BCBA8BB8.description: demonstrate an understanding of Deaf history and how it applies to the perspectives of American Deaf culture.

BDE45088842C45E9934D006B8586EEC8.description: show evidence of appreciation of the contributions to arts and sciences by the Deaf and how they are applied to the perspectives of American Deaf culture; and

857992A9C32B4879AC55ED47247ADA95.description: show evidence of appreciation of ASL literature created by the Deaf and how it applies to the perspectives of American Deaf culture;

126842A4BA28444D8143633FF0D3E5B5.description: recognize and use Deaf cultural norms to demonstrate, in writing or ASL, an understanding of the perspectives of American Deaf culture;

BD8BC0D38AC4442BB004C40CD24E6FD2.description: Cultures. The student gains knowledge and understanding of American Deaf culture. The student is expected to:

022325D6524D47E2BACDC29BA78A3579.description: create and express ASL literature, including handshape stories, that follows traditional cultural features.

5B7904E69EE44272A130838143D519CA.description: demonstrate appropriate usage of ASL phonology, morphology, syntax, semantics, and pragmatics; and

1955B382AD8645758E783667EFB09EA6.description: convey information in ASL using concepts, classifiers, phrases, and sentences to others without voice;

3608B5324B6C45F59436364B86787FE6.description: demonstrate an understanding of ASL such as stories, everyday commands, and instructions when dealing with familiar topics;

91EE1361FF044C5392D0F0A7AFC76DF5.description: engage in a variety of ASL exchanges of learned material to socialize and to provide and obtain information;

EF52CA7264DC426B82E3DB3C90ED5812.description: Communication. The student communicates in ASL using expressive and receptive communication skills without voice. The student is expected to:

8E5A61ED2E234A1D8C6E4D269F9E8B5D.description: show evidence of becoming a lifelong learner by using ASL at the novice proficiency level for personal enrichment and/or career development.

3BB04A3F6D7A4968BD0E46BDBE102E4E.description: be aware of methods of technology to communicate with the Deaf/ASL community; and

A3778D1D7DED4CB7891F15B353551E2E.description: apply ASL at the novice proficiency level in or out of the school setting through involvement in cultural activities such as attending Deaf events;

F9C9DC2BD9FE41E4988FD6F78D099BA9.description: Communities. The student participates in the Deaf/ASL community by using ASL. The student is expected to:

B43C9CB20A5144BF97C3EEE444B73E0D.description: demonstrate an understanding of how one language and culture can influence another.

458FBFC8AC5440B382C162293B30B804.description: demonstrate an understanding of the nature of culture through comparisons of the student's own culture and the American Deaf culture; and

2D75A41F9EC74549A22715493E264845.description: demonstrate an understanding of the nature of language through comparisons of the student's own language and ASL;

AF485D6924A44CF5A8185422E73B1B7B.description: Comparisons. The student develops insight into the nature of language and culture by comparing the student's own language and culture to ASL and American Deaf culture. The student is expected to:

4DD1D709CC6D4C3DB089B93BA0A5AD6C.description: use ASL to obtain, reinforce, or expand knowledge of other subject areas.

E7D0718A8D844A1EB07AD24340D298F8.description: use resources and digital technology to gain access to information about ASL and Deaf culture; and

40BB3095633E474CB7D98F552533F60C.description: Connections. The student uses ASL to make connections with other subject areas and to acquire information. The student is expected to:

8334E3A75AD640E1A42D29331BB89D8D.description: demonstrate an understanding of Deaf history and how it applies to the perspectives of American Deaf culture.

0813282055F341258896409C783FD92E.description: show evidence of appreciation of the contributions by the Deaf and how they are applied to the perspectives of American Deaf culture such as historical, geographical, political, artistic, and scientific avenues; and

10959326AFC24E5DB84D8DF27C420BFE.description: show evidence of appreciation of ASL literature created by the Deaf and how it applies to the perspectives of American Deaf culture;

FF9EB12B215A4922AF2B57DE7D2A25B5.description: recognize and use Deaf cultural norms to demonstrate an understanding of the perspectives of American Deaf culture;

089ED53664404149897745C34D241EA8.description: Cultures. The student gains knowledge and understanding of American Deaf culture. The student is expected to:

1624A864E57B496C8190B597B129348F.description: be exposed to and experience ASL literature such as handshape stories that follows traditional cultural features.

D802CEA7213441B08F17889BC6312A1E.description: demonstrate appropriate usage of ASL phonology, morphology, syntax, semantics, and pragmatics; and

4AACCDEC32EF47A0BD1CD6A0EE56B598.description: convey information in ASL using familiar words, concepts, classifiers, phrases, and sentences to others without voice;

EC2D266A61064B32A41A780C0E92B6EE.description: demonstrate an understanding of basic ASL such as simple stories, everyday commands, and brief instructions when dealing with familiar topics;

773ADE5D1CE34D30ADC40C1FE921C706.description: engage in a variety of ASL exchanges of learned material to socialize and to provide and obtain information;

A1B4E858474B4139B2D374BC36AF77A0.description: Communication. The student communicates in ASL using expressive and receptive communication skills without voice. The student is expected to:

FE166573D94F4CC0925FBD34B3DC03E2.description: demonstrate an awareness of language patterns such as word/character order, grammatical structures, and symbols.

A306B5F6523442F38F8031786AFB020A.description: engage in a variety of language learning strategies such as identifying cognates and recognizing word origins; and

4A8BF7DB78E74542BFF8B2DC6D29812A.description: The student develops effective language study skills. The student is expected to:

222ADC5B939D4B788BAB0F65C487D579.description: compare and contrast aspects of other cultures to the student's own culture.

65DD9611CDB1413F9AD68A7FEDA1D4EB.description: recognize the cultural products such as art, music, food, clothing, or other culturally related examples in selected regions or countries; and

9FB95ABDEF0F44B48B6C65933DCBE94A.description: identify and describe cultural practices in selected regions or countries;

8C8F41C8421F494BA06FE35317ED419F.description: The student demonstrates an understanding of cultures. The student is expected to:

B47D8B2FD436475E8E393A5CBCBCDF0B.description: apply basic communication skills in the target language(s), including listening, speaking, reading, and writing.

5926C4DBD1E54AC1974D4F3EAF5E015A.description: compare and contrast aspects of other languages to English and the student's native language; and

6C5062DDCC4F4E97BAF44F4A76D10080.description: engage in different types of language learning activities;

0BC5ECA341A5449BB1D4BE391F8A44FD.description: The student demonstrates an understanding of the elements of language(s). The student is expected to:
